verses.plain: The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see.

tokens.t: The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz did see.

verses.plain: Lift ye up a banner upon the high mountain, exalt the voice unto them, shake the hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.

tokens.t: Lift ye up a banner upon the high mountain, exalt the voice unto them, shake the hand, that they may go into the gates of the nobles.

verses.plain: I have commanded my sanctified ones, I have also called my mighty ones for mine anger, even them that rejoice in my highness.

tokens.t: I have commanded my sanctified ones, I have also called my mighty ones for mine anger,
them that rejoice in my highness.

verses.plain: The noise of a multitude in the mountains, like as of a great people; a tumultuous noise of the kingdoms of nations gathered together: the LORD of hosts mustereth the host of the battle.

tokens.t: The noise of a multitude in the mountains, like as of a great people; a tumultuous noise of the kingdoms of nations gathered together: the
of hosts mustereth the host of the battle.

verses.plain: They come from a far country, from the end of heaven, even the LORD, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.

tokens.t: They come from a far country, from the end of heaven,
the
, and the weapons of his indignation, to destroy the whole land.

verses.plain: ¶ Howl ye; for the day of the LORD is at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.

tokens.t: ¶ Howl ye; for the day of the
at hand; it shall come as a destruction from the Almighty.

verses.plain: Therefore shall all hands be faint, and every man’s heart shall melt:

tokens.t: Therefore shall all hands be faint, and every man’s heart shall melt:

verses.plain: And they shall be afraid: pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be in pain as a woman that travaileth: they shall be amazed one at another; their faces shall be as flames.

tokens.t: And they shall be afraid: pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be in pain as a woman that travaileth: they shall be amazed one at another; their faces
flames.

verses.plain: Behold, the day of the LORD cometh, cruel both with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the land desolate: and he shall destroy the sinners thereof out of it.

tokens.t: Behold, the day of the
cometh, cruel both with wrath and fierce anger, to lay the land desolate: and he shall destroy the sinners thereof out of it.

verses.plain: For the stars of heaven and the constellations thereof shall not give their light: the sun shall be darkened in his going forth, and the moon shall not cause her light to shine.

tokens.t: For the stars of heaven and the constellations thereof shall not give their light: the sun shall be darkened in his going forth, and the moon shall not cause her light to shine.

verses.plain: And I will punish the world for their evil, and the wicked for their iniquity; and I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease, and will lay low the haughtiness of the terrible.

tokens.t: And I will punish the world for
evil, and the wicked for their iniquity; and I will cause the arrogancy of the proud to cease, and will lay low the haughtiness of the terrible.

verses.plain: I will make a man more precious than fine gold; even a man than the golden wedge of Ophir.

tokens.t: I will make a man more precious than fine gold; even a man than the golden wedge of Ophir.

verses.plain: Therefore I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the LORD of hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.

tokens.t: Therefore I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove out of her place, in the wrath of the
of hosts, and in the day of his fierce anger.

verses.plain: And it shall be as the chased roe, and as a sheep that no man taketh up: they shall every man turn to his own people, and flee every one into his own land.

tokens.t: And it shall be as the chased roe, and as a sheep that no man taketh up: they shall every man turn to his own people, and flee every one into his own land.

verses.plain: Every one that is found shall be thrust through; and every one that is joined unto them shall fall by the sword.

tokens.t: Every one that is found shall be thrust through; and every one that is joined
shall fall by the sword.

verses.plain: Their children also shall be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be spoiled, and their wives ravished.

tokens.t: Their children also shall be dashed to pieces before their eyes; their houses shall be spoiled, and their wives ravished.

verses.plain: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not regard silver; and as for gold, they shall not delight in it.

tokens.t: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, which shall not regard silver; and
gold, they shall not delight in it.

verses.plain: Their bows also shall dash the young men to pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eye shall not spare children.

tokens.t: bows also shall dash the young men to pieces; and they shall have no pity on the fruit of the womb; their eye shall not spare children.

verses.plain: ¶ And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldees’ excellency, shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.

tokens.t: ¶ And Babylon, the glory of kingdoms, the beauty of the Chaldees’ excellency, shall be as when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah.

verses.plain: It shall never be inhabited, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation: neither shall the Arabian pitch tent there; neither shall the shepherds make their fold there.

tokens.t: It shall never be inhabited, neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation: neither shall the Arabian pitch tent there; neither shall the shepherds make their fold there.

verses.plain: But wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.

tokens.t: But wild beasts of the desert shall lie there; and their houses shall be full of doleful creatures; and owls shall dwell there, and satyrs shall dance there.

verses.plain: And the wild beasts of the islands shall cry in their desolate houses, and dragons in their pleasant palaces: and her time is near to come, and her days shall not be prolonged.

tokens.t: And the wild beasts of the islands shall cry in their desolate houses, and dragons in
pleasant palaces: and her time
near to come, and her days shall not be prolonged.

footnotes.text: one…: Heb. every man at his neighbour
flames: Heb. faces of the flames
owls: or, ostriches: Heb. daughters of the owl
